alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; Macon; Menard; Sangamon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Menard, Logan, northeastern Sangamon, western De Witt, and northwestern Macon Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clinton to Elkhart. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Decatur, Lincoln, Clinton, Sherman, Forsyth, Riverton, Maroa, Mount Pulaski, Williamsville, Harristown, Warrensburg, Illiopolis, Niantic, Wapella, Elkhart, Latham, Kenney, Middletown and Chestnut. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 between mile markers 101 and 126. Interstate 72 between mile markers 135 and 142. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: De Witt; Logan; Macon; Menard; Sangamon
